page.title: 12TRANSPORT
page.content: The Bedpan (Bedford-London St Pancras) Line takes on average 750 passengers a week from Flitwick. Trains stop every half hour and go to Bedford in 12 minutes, Luton in 15 minutes or London in 45 minutes. It is likely that the rapid expansion of Flitwick is largely due to this fast and efficient service as the station master reports that most passengers are commuters or shoppers. A plaque on the station platform commemorates the opening of the station in 1868. A heightened road bridge and lengthened platforms commemorate the completed electrification of the line in 1983. Eastern Counties Bus Company does not try to compete with British Rail so bus services are few and far between, but if the local inhabitants really want to get away from it all Luton Airport is only 15 miles away.
